fields.title: Food Distribution Welcome
fields.content:
Welcome to the Food Distribution System

This system is under construction for the Fifth Season Cooperative, a local food network in Viroqua, Wisconsin.

It will help buyers to order, distributors to deliver, and producers to get paid.

If you have login credentials, you may login.

fields.title: Food Distribution Help
fields.content:
Back to operational dashboard

Getting started

The Distribution system has two main sections: Admin and the weekly Operational tabs. Use Admin for initial setup of master data, and flexible viewing or correcting of operational details. Use the Operational tabs for the regular weekly operations cycle, and an easier way to enter product plans.

Use Admin to create the following master information:

  • Food Network
  • Producers
  • Products

    • Products may have other products for parents. Parent products appear in the Category column in product tables. For example, Hamburger per lb may have a parent Beef, which may have a parent Meat. So you would see Meat, Beef in the Category column for Hamburger per lb.

    Typically parent products would not be sold. In other words, you would not sell plain Meat or Beef, but you would sell Hamburger per lb. The categories are useful to make the product tables more readable, and also they may be used for aggregate reports: for example, how much Meat have we sold so far this year?

  • Customers
  • Party Users

    • Customers have their own section of the system for ordering. Party Users associate system users with the customer they work for. When a Party User logs into the system, they will automatically be redirected to the Customer section of the system, where they can see their own help page.

  • Processors
  • Distributors
  • Process Types

    • These specify different types of food processing, for example, meat slaughtering and cutting, or making frozen pizza.

  • Service Types

    • These specify different types of services, for example, food processing services or transportation.

Pre-season (or any time): enter plans for producers

Plans are entered by producer, product and date range. Plans ideally would be entered based on last year's demand, maybe adjusted by a growth factor.

The plans determine which producers and products appear in the Availability and Process forms for a given date. If no plans, the producer will not appear in the selection list. If no product plan, the product will not appear in the form once you have selected a producer.

You can use the Plan tab to enter plans for one date range per product for a producer (for example, for the whole season). If you want many date ranges per product for a producer, use Product Plans in Admin.

Weekly operation cycle

  1. Enter what's available this week

    2. Use the Avail tab to enter what's available from producers, either on the farm or somewhere else. Each availability row shows two quantities: Ready and Received. Ready means ready for pickup. Received means received into warehouse inventory. The Custodian field refers to who has the goods other than the Producer. Could be a Processor or a Distributor, and the goods might in the distributor's warehouse and so do not need to be picked up.

    Use the Process tab to enter food that is being processed this week, and is now ready to be ordered. This food will usually be held at the Processor's.

    The system keeps track of available quantities by deleting deliveries.

    Expiration: Lots of available product expire (no longer are available) after their expiration date. The expiration date is set automatically when the lot is created, by adding the product's expiration days to the lot's creation date. The default expiration is 6 days. In other words, lots will become unavailable next week. If you want all lots of a product to be available for longer, change the expiration days for that product, and new lots will be available longer (but existing lots will not be changed). If you want a particular lot or lots to be available longer, go into Admin and change the expiration date on the lot (Inventory Item).

  2. Send Fresh List emails to customers

    3. This feature is temporarily disabled for redesign.

  3. Enter orders

    4. Orders may be entered by customers using their own section of the system, or network staff may enter orders through the Order tab. The form shows all available inventory items from all producers, and you enter the quantities of each item that the current customer wants to order. You can also override unit prices, and enter notes about customer special requests.

  4. Fill and ship orders

    5. Staff prints out the Order Table for the delivery crew (from the Orders tab). The delivery crew marks it up to show which producer's food will go to which customers.

    Staff then enters the delivery info using the Update Lots tab. Sometimes filling one customer order item requires food from several producers. Update Lots accomodates this requirement.

  5. Manage shorts

    6. Use the Orders tab to view shorts, change short orders, and short notice emails to customers..

  6. Send order emails to customers

    7. This feature is temporarily disabled for redesign.

  7. Print invoices

    8. Use the Invoice tab to print invoices for each customer order. The printed invoices may be delivered with the order.

  8. Enter payments from customers

    9. Payments from customers can (eventually) enter the system three ways:

    1. The customer pays invoices online with a credit card,
    2. you enter customer payments and associate them with orders,
    3. you just mark orders "paid".

    Only the third method is implemented now.

    You can mark orders "paid" through the Order tab, or Orders in Admin.

  9. Compute payments to producers, processors and distributors

    10. The Network pays producers etc. after the customer pays the order. The Producer Payments tab tells how much money is due to which producers, and Payment Update computes and enters the payments that will be paid out this week.

    When payments are due: If the Product or Service Type is marked "pay on terms", then the member is paid on the Food Network's member terms. If not, the member payment is due when the customer pays for the order.

  10. Print statements for producers, processors and distributors

    11. The Statements tab generates printable statements to accompany payments. Enter a date range, and statements will be generated for all payments within the range. Note: the payments must be entered using Payment Update before the statements will appear.
